description: TransactGetItems is a synchronous operation that atomically retrieves multiple items from one or more tables (but not from indexes) in a single account and Region. A TransactGetItems call can contain up to 100 TransactGetItem objects, each of which contains a Get structure that specifies an item to retrieve from a table in the account and Region. A call to TransactGetItems cannot retrieve items from tables in more than one Amazon Web Services account or Region. The aggregate size of the items in the transaction cannot exceed 4 MB. DynamoDB rejects the entire TransactGetItems request if any of the following is true:

parameters.name: TransactItems
parameters.description: An ordered array of up to 100 TransactGetItem objects, each of which contains a Get structure. (dict) --- Specifies an item to be retrieved as part of the transaction. Contains the primary key that identifies the item to get, together with the name of the table that contains the item, and optionally the specific attributes of the item to retrieve. A map of attribute names to AttributeValue objects that specifies the primary key of the item to retrieve. (string) --- (dict) --- Represents the data for an attribute. Each attribute value is described as a name-value pair. The name is the data type, and the value is the data itself. For more information, see Data Types in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. S (string) --- An attribute of type String. For example: "S": "Hello" N (string) --- An attribute of type Number. For example: "N": "123.45" Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. However, DynamoDB treats them as number type attributes for mathematical operations. B (bytes) --- An attribute of type Binary. For example: "B": "dGhpcyB0ZXh0IGlzIGJhc2U2NC1lbmNvZGVk" SS (list) --- An attribute of type String Set. For example: "SS": ["Giraffe", "Hippo" ,"Zebra"] (string) --- NS (list) --- An attribute of type Number Set. For example: "NS": ["42.2", "-19", "7.5", "3.14"] Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. (string) --- BS (list) --- An attribute of type Binary Set. For example: "BS": ["U3Vubnk=", "UmFpbnk=", "U25vd3k="] (bytes) --- M (dict) --- An attribute of type Map. For example: "M": {"Name": {"S": "Joe"}, "Age": {"N": "35"}} (string) --- (dict) --- Represents the data for an attribute. L (list) --- An attribute of type List. For example: "L": [ {"S": "Cookies"} , {"S": "Coffee"}, {"N": "3.14159"}] (dict) --- Represents the data for an attribute. NULL (boolean) --- An attribute of type Null. For example: "NULL": true BOOL (boolean) --- An attribute of type Boolean. For example: "BOOL": true The name of the table from which to retrieve the specified item. You can also provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the table in this parameter. ProjectionExpression (string) --- A string that identifies one or more attributes of the specified item to retrieve from the table. The attributes in the expression must be separated by commas. If no attribute names are specified, then all attributes of the specified item are returned. If any of the requested attributes are not found, they do not appear in the result. ExpressionAttributeNames (dict) --- One or more substitution tokens for attribute names in the ProjectionExpression parameter. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_params.name: Get
nested_params.description: Contains the primary key that identifies the item to get, together with the name of the table that contains the item, and optionally the specific attributes of the item to retrieve.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: A map of attribute names to AttributeValue objects that specifies the primary key of the item to retrieve.

nested_params.name: S
nested_params.description: An attribute of type String. For example: "S": "Hello"

nested_params.name: N
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Number. For example: "N": "123.45" Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. However, DynamoDB treats them as number type attributes for mathematical operations.

nested_params.name: B
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Binary. For example: "B": "dGhpcyB0ZXh0IGlzIGJhc2U2NC1lbmNvZGVk"

nested_params.name: SS
nested_params.description: An attribute of type String Set. For example: "SS": ["Giraffe", "Hippo" ,"Zebra"]

nested_params.name: NS
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Number Set. For example: "NS": ["42.2", "-19", "7.5", "3.14"] Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. However, DynamoDB treats them as number type attributes for mathematical operations.

nested_params.name: BS
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Binary Set. For example: "BS": ["U3Vubnk=", "UmFpbnk=", "U25vd3k="]

nested_params.name: M
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Map. For example: "M": {"Name": {"S": "Joe"}, "Age": {"N": "35"}}

nested_params.name: L
nested_params.description: An attribute of type List. For example: "L": [ {"S": "Cookies"} , {"S": "Coffee"}, {"N": "3.14159"}]

nested_params.name: NULL
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Null. For example: "NULL": true.

nested_params.name: BOOL
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Boolean. For example: "BOOL": true.

nested_params.name: TableName
nested_params.description: The name of the table from which to retrieve the specified item. You can also provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the table in this parameter.

nested_params.name: ProjectionExpression
nested_params.description: A string that identifies one or more attributes of the specified item to retrieve from the table. The attributes in the expression must be separated by commas. If no attribute names are specified, then all attributes of the specified item are returned. If any of the requested attributes are not found, they do not appear in the result.

nested_params.name: ExpressionAttributeNames
nested_params.description: One or more substitution tokens for attribute names in the ProjectionExpression parameter.

nested_items.name: ConsumedCapacity
nested_items.description: If the ReturnConsumedCapacity value was TOTAL, this is an array of ConsumedCapacity objects, one for each table addressed by TransactGetItem objects in the TransactItems parameter. These ConsumedCapacity objects report the read-capacity units consumed by the TransactGetItems call in that table.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that was affected by the operation. If you had specified the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a table in the input, you'll see the table ARN in the response.

nested_items.name: CapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of capacity units consumed by the operation.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of read capacity units consumed by the operation.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of write capacity units consumed by the operation.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of read capacity units consumed on a table or an index.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of write capacity units consumed on a table or an index.

nested_items.name: CapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of capacity units consumed on a table or an index.

nested_items.name: LocalSecondaryIndexes
nested_items.description: The amount of throughput consumed on each local index affected by the operation.

nested_items.name: Responses
nested_items.description: An ordered array of up to 100 ItemResponse objects, each of which corresponds to the TransactGetItem object in the same position in the TransactItems array. Each ItemResponse object contains a Map of the name-value pairs that are the projected attributes of the requested item.
